metadata.title: CVE-2023-29551 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 111. Some of these bugs showedevidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort someof these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox for Android < 112, Firefox < 112, and Focusfor Android < 112.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
